text: Currently this isn't supported
Datasync apps are only developed by HubSpot at this time
another one
cc <@U01JT537HG9>
hello <@U01QVR44MEY> In that case, what would be the process to integrate this functionality into my app so that my clients can synchronize their data to my database?
when you say invoices do you mean this type of invoice?
Hi <@U044QGKB38E> - Like Carter indicates (thanks!) data sync is a closed piece of technology right now. We internally build these syncs using our internal sync engine.
<@U044QGKB38E> You would have to build out the front and backend yourself a pretty good example of this is <http://zaybra.com|Zaybra>
Super doable but it will take a good amount of work to make it awesome
Is it possible to contract your services to integrate this synchronization module in our app?
Yes it's possible although I don't think I would be the cheapest option for you
<@U01QVR44MEY> one more query, how do apps like mailchimp or google Contacts have this module, which has the HubSpot interface?
Not exactly. We do our invoicing through our Infor ERP
I mean you always can use zapier or make to copy over the information

```good morning, we currently have developed a data synchronization module but when synchronizing contacts in a massive way, say about 50k, it throws us an error 429 indicating that too many requests were made in a short time, how can we scale the number of requests per minute to the services from HubSpot?```
have you looked at the limits? <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/apps/api_guidelines>
typically you just have to throttle/slowdown your calls
I will validate it thank you very much Stefen Phelps
You can also use the batch api
Or the import api if you want to get crazy
